name: Neon Cleaner (AmazeMeGameJam)
description:
Info:

Made in 48 hours and 5 minutes for AmazeMeGameJam GMS2.

https://itch.io/jam/amaze-me-game-jam

The theme was "NEON" and no special rules that I could find so this is what I made I guess.

Timelapse + Gameplay: Jam Comments:

Since there were no special rules or anything for this jam I didn't start from nothing this time.

I ported over a bunch of my own systems to GMS2 the day before starting work on the game (didn't record that part because literally nothing happened).

So I used these systems for the game, which obviously sped up the process quite a bit and allowing for a greater number of effects / gameplay feel.

All textures, audio, levels, etc and most of the game logic was made during the jam though, it's all in the timelapse above.

But anyway, I got nothing else to comment on really other than as usual (apparently), the game turned out better than expected.

Feel free to leave any feedback.

Description:

Old school style FPS puzzle platformer (or something).

Deliver all the "Neons" to the level exit and reach it yourself before being zapped by a laserfield.

Features:

8 Levels.

Possibly challenging gameplay.

Showcase of misc things that are not usually done with GameMaker Studio.

Controls:

WASD = Move.

Mouse = Look around.

Left Mouse Button = Pick up / Throw.

Right Mouse Button = Drop / Place (hold shift).

Space = Jump.

E = Continue to next level (if finished).

R = Restart Level.

Note:

Performance will likely not be optimal on lower end devices using the default game options.

Use the in-game options to lower graphics settings, should improve performance.
